DOC.brief_summary: This randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled trial choline supplementation child Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders ( FASD ) . The primary outcome measure cognitive measure .
DOC.brief_title: Choline Supplementation Neurodevelopmental Intervention Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders
DOC.detailed_description: This project third series randomize , double-blind placebo-controlled trial choline bitartrate child age 2-5 diagnosed Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders ( FASD ) . Pre-clinical data suggests choline may attenuate cognitive deficit cause prenatal alcohol exposure ( especially memory deficit ) . This study evaluate effect daily choline supplementation vs. placebo 9 month . Outcome measure include elicit imitation memory paradigm , global cognitive functioning , aspect executive functioning . The study also continue collect safety tolerability data .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Ages 2 year 5 year age 2 . Available parent legal guardian capable give informed consent participation . 3 . Documented prenatal alcohol exposure ( selfreport , social service record , adoption record ) . 4 . Modified Institute Medicine ( IOM ) criteria Fetal Alcohol Syndrome ( FAS ) , Partial Fetal Alcohol Syndrome ( PFAS ) , AlcoholRelated Neurodevelopmental Disorder ( ARND ) ( Hoyme , May , et al. , 2005 ) . 1 . Known history neurological condition ( ex . epilepsy , traumatic brain injury ) 2 . Known history medical condition know affect brain function . 3 . Known history neurodevelopmental disorder ( ex . autism , Down syndrome ) 4 . Known history low birthweight ( < 1500 gram )
